cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly life cycle includes the egg stage as its initial phase.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject life cycle process includes the object as one of its distinct stages.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly life cycle includes the larval (caterpillar) stage.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a life cycle concept encompasses a specific developmental stage as one of its component phases.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The butterfly life cycle includes the adult butterfly stage as its final phase.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a life cycle or developmental process includes the given stage as one of its constituent phases.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a life cycle or developmental process includes the given stage as one of its distinct component phases.
args.justification: All three relations link the 'butterfly life cycle' to one of its developmental stages (egg, larval, adult) in a part–whole sense. They share identical predicate semantics (life cycle includes stage), so they should use a single normalized canonical_rel_name. The existing variants ('includes_life_cycle_stage', 'includes_life_stage', 'has_life_cycle_stage') are purely wording differences. This is best modeled as a composition relation (stages as components of the overall process), while temporal ordering is captured via qualifiers, so rel_cls_group should be COMPOSITION rather than TEMPORALITY. A unified rel_cls 'life_cycle_stage_relation' is more consistent than mixing with 'process_stage_relation' for the same pattern.
args.remark: Normalized all life-cycle-to-stage edges to a single predicate 'includes_life_cycle_stage' and aligned them under the same relation class and COMPOSITION group for schema consistency.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a life cycle or developmental process includes the given stage as one of its distinct component phases.

The existing variants ('includes_life_cycle_stage', 'includes_life_stage', 'has_life_cycle_stage') are purely wording differences. This is best modeled as a composition relation (stages as components of the overall process), while temporal ordering is captured via qualifiers, so rel_cls_group should be COMPOSITION rather than TEMPORALITY. A unified rel_cls 'life_cycle_stage_relation' is more consistent than mixing with 'process_stage_relation' for the same pattern.
